page.title: 04Market Day in St.Albans.
page.content: On{market}day everone is bustling about looking for goods.The{St.Albans {market}started in 948. The{Saturday} market sold farm produce and general items.The Wednesday{cattle market }was called Cow day. Cow day ended in 1971. A smaller version of the Saturday market took its place. Today there are about{150 stalls,} selling anything from sweets to furniture.The {stallholders}have a {long day,}some starting at{5.30am}and} working until{6.30pm.}Most stall- holders have family to help them. Most stallholders have had their stalls for several years and come on both Wednesday and Saturday.The{fish stall has been in the same family for{160 } {years.}Most of the {shoppers }come once a week from St.Albans and nearby towns,usually for domestic items. They enjoy the atmosphere and fresh air.
